meanings.definition: A unit of area equal to one square meter.
meanings.sent1: The garden was just one centare in size.
meanings.sent2: The farmer measured the field in centares.
meanings.sent3: The centare of grass seemed to be the perfect spot for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her smile covered a centare of joy.
meanings.sent5: The tiny centare of cloth was all she needed to mend the tear.

meanings.definition: To measure or mark off in centares.
meanings.sent1: He decided to centare the area before building the fence.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor centared the land accurately.
meanings.sent3: She would centare the room with caution tape for the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist centared the canvas before starting to paint.
meanings.sent5: The tailor would centare the fabric before cutting it for the dress.

meanings.definition: A plot of land measuring one centare.
meanings.sent1: The small garden was a beautiful centare of greenery.
meanings.sent2: They purchased a centare for their new home.
meanings.sent3: The centare of land was just enough for a tiny house.
meanings.sent4: The centare of soil was perfect for growing vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The centare of land was a peaceful retreat from the city.
